clinical_study.brief_title: ANRS12373 GUNDO SO - Evaluation of an Empowerment Program for WLHIV in Mali
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Short- and Mid-term Effects of an Empowerment Program Focused on Serostatus Disclosure Management for Women Living With HIV in Mali

lead_sponsor.agency: French National Institute for Health and Medical Research-French National Agency for Research on AIDS and Viral Hepatitis (Inserm-ANRS)

collaborator.agency: Centre Population et Développement (CEPED), Paris, France
Groupe de Recherche en Psychologie Sociale (GRePS), Bron, France

clinical_study.source: French National Institute for Health and Medical Research-French National Agency for Research on AIDS and Viral Hepatitis (Inserm-ANRS)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this research is to measure the short- and mid-term effects of an empowerment program focused on serostatus disclosure management for women living with HIV (WLHIV) in Mali on the "burden of secrecy".

detailed_description.textblock:
Serostatus disclosure is a critical issue for persons living with HIV (PLHIV). Studies identified numerous benefits associated with disclosure, but various negative consequences have also been documented. Gender inequality must be taken into account regarding the disclosure issue, in particular in Mali, where women are economically dependent and have a low decision-making power. Moreover, in Mali, since 2006, PLHIV have a legal obligation to disclose their serostatus to their spouse and sexual partner(s) " as soon as possible, or within 6 weeks " after the diagnosis. Although this law is not enforced, it highlights the sensitive nature of the serostatus disclosure issue and raise concerns among PLHIV and other stakeholders.
To support women living with HIV (WLHIV), an empowerment program (Gundo-So) was implemented by ARCAD-SIDA in Mali, in collaboration with several partners. This program aims to empower WLHIV, so that they can make informed decision about disclosing or keeping their serostatus secret in their various life contexts, and that they can identify strategies to disclose or to keep the secret, as well as to manage potential negative reactions. Gundo-So ("The room of confidences") was adapted from a program established in quebec and has been implemented in Mali.
The objective of this research is to measure the short- and mid-term effects of an empowerment program focused on serostatus disclosure management for women living with HIV (WLHIV) in Mali on the "burden of secrecy".
The evaluation of the effects of the Gundo-So program will be helpful to assess the relevance of a national or subregional extension of the program, or even an adaptation to other target populations (e.g. heterosexual men and men who have sex with men living with HIV).

primary_outcome.measure: Short term evaluation of the burden associated with the disclosure issue using questionnaires
primary_outcome.time_frame: The short term effect will be measured at the end of the intervention and compared between Group 1 and 2. Up to 6 months from the beginning of the randomization to the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of the management of the sharing of the serological status. Empowerment in sharing the HIV status (questionnaire)

primary_outcome.measure: Short term evaluation of the burden associated with the secrecy issue using questionnaires
primary_outcome.time_frame: The short term effect will be measured at the end of the intervention and compared between Group 1 and 2. Up to 6 months from the beginning of the randomization to the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of the management of the secret of the serological status. Empowerment in keeping secret the HIV status (questionnaire)

primary_outcome.measure: Mid term evaluation of the burden associated with the disclosure issue using questionnaires
primary_outcome.time_frame: The mid term effect will be measured 9 months after the intervention : up to 9 months after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of the management of the sharing of the serological status. Empowerment in sharing the HIV status (questionnaire)

primary_outcome.measure: Mid term evaluation of the burden associated with the secrecy issue using questionnaires
primary_outcome.time_frame: The mid term effect will be measured 9 months after the intervention : up to 9 months after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of the management of the secret of the serological status. Empowerment in keeping secret the HIV status (questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in quality of life of WLHIV: questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the randomization and then immediately after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the changes in quality of life (questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of sexual practices and use of risk reduction strategies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the randomization and then immediately after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Assess changes of sexual practices and risk reductions strategies (questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the randomization and then immediately after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Assess changes of reported compliance throught HIV antiretroviral treatments (questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 6 months before the intervention until the last follow up (total 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Access changes in HIV viral load due to the intervention (via the medical file)

secondary_outcome.measure: Biological data : cluster of differentiation 4 levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 6 months before the intervention until the last follow up (total 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Access changes in cluster of differentiation 4 levels due to the intervention (via the medical file)
Assess the satisfaction of the intervention using questionnaire

arm_group.description: 3 months after enrollment, each big groups of 16 will be split in two groups. Women in G1 will receive the intervention Gundo-So immediately. (From month 3 to month 6). 112 women will be in immediate arm in 14 groups of 8 women.

3 months after enrollment, each big groups of 16 will be split in two groups. Women in G2 will receive the intervention Gundo-So 3 months after. (From month 6 to month 9). 112 women will be in delayed arm in 14 groups of 8 women.

intervention.description: Gundo-So was adapted from a program established in quebec. It has been implemented in Mali following 3 phases: 1) cultural adaptation; 2) validation using a pre-post intervention evaluation; 3) scale-up The programm consists on 9 group meetings group spread over 9 weeks (for 8 WLHIV + 2 trained community-based leaders). Each meeting has some particular thematics with adapted tools.
intervention.other_name: Gundo So - The room of confidences

study_pop.textblock:
The programm Gundo So has been adapted for groups of malian women living with HIV (WLHIV). The study population is described with the inclusion criteria. Moreover, in order to participate at this research, women have to answer "Yes" at at least one of those 2 questions :
- (1) is it difficult for you to share your HIV serostatus ; and (1.1) is it inconvenient for you?
- (2) is it difficult for you to keep your HIV serostatus secret; and (2.1) is it inconvenient for you?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women living with HIV
- living in Bamako area (Mali)
- over 18 years old
- knowing their serological status for more than 6 months and less than 5 years
- being available to participate in the 9 weekly sessions lasting about 2 hours each.
Exclusion Criteria:
- having already participated in Gundo-So

reference.citation: Bernier A, Yattassaye A, Beaulieu-Prévost D, Otis J, Henry E, Flores-Aranda J, Massie L, Préau M, Keita BD. Empowering Malian women living with HIV regarding serostatus disclosure management: Short-term effects of a community-based intervention. Patient Educ Couns. 2018 Feb;101(2):248-255. doi: 10.1016/j.pec.2017.07.030. Epub 2017 Jul 26.
